title: Algonquin Provincial Park
description: Vast park with hiking, canoeing, camping, wildlife viewing.
activityDetails: Hiking, canoeing, kayaking, camping, fishing, wildlife photography, visitor centre.
cost: Park permit, camping fees, rental fees.

title: Prince Edward County
description: Island community known for wineries, breweries, beaches, arts, and culinary scene.
activityDetails: Wine tasting, craft beer, Sandbanks Provincial Park, cycling, art galleries, farm-to-table dining.

title: Tobermory & Bruce Peninsula National Park
description: Clear turquoise waters, Grotto, Fathom Five National Marine Park (shipwrecks), hiking trails.
registrationDeadline: Book Grotto parking/Flowerpot Island ferry in advance
activityDetails: Hiking (Bruce Trail), swimming (cold!), snorkeling/diving, boat tours to Flowerpot Island, visitor centre.

title: Manitoulin Island
description: Largest freshwater island in the world. Indigenous culture, hiking, Dark Sky Preserve.
activityDetails: Hiking (Cup and Saucer Trail), beaches, Indigenous cultural experiences, Bridal Veil Falls, Dark Sky Preserve for stargazing.
travelTime: Approx 6-8 hrs (via Chi-Cheemaun Ferry or drive via Sudbury)

title: Muskoka Lakes (Rosseau, Joseph, Muskoka)
description: Iconic cottage country with boating, resorts, charming towns (Gravenhurst, Bracebridge, Port Carling).
activityDetails: Boating, swimming, fishing, hiking, shopping, steamship cruises (Segwun/Wenonah II), Santa's Village.

title: Blue Mountain Resort & Village
description: Year-round resort with skiing/snowboarding in winter, hiking, biking, gondola, village activities in summer.
activityDetails: Skiing, snowboarding, hiking, mountain biking, zip-lining, ropes courses, beach (nearby), shopping, dining.

title: Sandbanks Provincial Park
description: Famous for its large freshwater sand dunes and beaches on Lake Ontario.
startDate: May-October (day use often capacity-limited in summer)
registrationDeadline: Book day use vehicle permits in advance during peak season
activityDetails: Swimming, sunbathing, hiking, birdwatching, camping (book well in advance).

title: Thousand Islands National Park & Gananoque
description: Archipelago of islands in the St. Lawrence River. Boat tours, kayaking, historic castles (Boldt Castle - US side, Singer Castle).
activityDetails: Boat cruises through the islands, kayaking, hiking on island trails, visiting Gananoque, Boldt Castle (requires US entry).
cost: Park fees (if landing on islands), boat tour costs.

title: Elora Gorge Conservation Area
description: Scenic gorge with tubing, hiking, splash pad, camping.
activityDetails: Tubing down the Grand River, hiking trails along the gorge, swimming (quarry nearby), camping, Elora village.
cost: Park entry, tubing rental, camping fees.

title: Lake Superior Provincial Park
description: Dramatic coastline on Lake Superior, rugged hiking, pictographs, camping.
location: North of Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario
activityDetails: Hiking (Coastal Trail), canoeing, kayaking, Agawa Rock Pictographs, beaches, camping.

title: Sleeping Giant Provincial Park
description: Peninsula on Lake Superior resembling a sleeping giant. Extensive hiking trails, views, wildlife.
location: Near Thunder Bay, Ontario (further than 8hrs, but iconic Ontario attraction)
activityDetails: Hiking (Top of the Giant Trail), camping, wildlife viewing, Sea Lion rock formation, visitor centre.
travelTime: Approx 15-16 hrs (Consider if "similar locations" allows for iconic but further spots, or stick strictly to 8hr)

title: Killarney Provincial Park
description: La Cloche Mountains (white quartzite), sapphire lakes, hiking, canoeing.
skillLevel: All levels to Difficult (The Crack trail)
registrationDeadline: Book campsites/permits (especially backcountry) far in advance
activityDetails: Hiking ("The Crack", Granite Ridge), canoeing, kayaking, camping (front and backcountry), painting/photography (Group of Seven inspiration).

title: Ottawa
description: Canada's capital city. Parliament Hill, national museums, Rideau Canal, ByWard Market.
activityDetails: Visit Parliament Buildings, Canadian Museum of History, National Gallery, War Museum, skate/boat on Rideau Canal, explore ByWard Market.

title: St. Jacobs Farmers' Market & Village
description: Large farmers' market, Mennonite culture, outlet mall, charming village.
startDate: Market: Thurs & Sat (Tues in summer). Village: Year-round.
activityDetails: Shop at farmers' market (produce, crafts, food), explore St. Jacobs village shops, learn about Mennonite culture, visit outlet mall.

title: Kawartha Lakes
description: Region with numerous lakes, towns (Bobcaygeon, Fenelon Falls), Trent-Severn Waterway, fishing, boating.
activityDetails: Boating, fishing, swimming, Lock 32 (Bobcaygeon), hiking, cycling, exploring small towns.

title: Point Pelee National Park
description: Southernmost point of mainland Canada, renowned for bird migration, marshes, beach.
activityDetails: Birdwatching (especially spring/fall migration), walking/cycling trails, Marsh Boardwalk, Tip exhibit, swimming.

title: Wasaga Beach Provincial Park
description: World's longest freshwater beach. Swimming, sunbathing, trails.
registrationDeadline: Can get very busy, arrive early
activityDetails: Swimming, sunbathing, beach activities, hiking/cycling Nancy Island Historic Site trails.

title: Flowerpot Island (part of Fathom Five National Marine Park)
description: Island accessible by tour boat from Tobermory, known for its "flowerpot" rock formations, caves, and hiking trails.
registrationDeadline: Book ferry tickets in advance (Blue Heron Cruises, Bruce Anchor Cruises)
activityDetails: Hiking trails to flowerpots and lighthouse, exploring caves, picnicking. No overnight camping on island itself.
cost: Ferry cost + National Park entry if not already covered.
travelTime: Approx 3.5-4.5 hrs to Tobermory, then ferry

title: Bon Echo Provincial Park
description: Features Mazinaw Rock with Indigenous pictographs, hiking, camping, canoeing on Mazinaw Lake.
registrationDeadline: Book campsites/permits/ferry to Rock well in advance
activityDetails: Hiking (Cliff Top Trail), canoeing/kayaking to see pictographs, camping, swimming, visitor centre.
cost: Park permit, camping fees, ferry tour fee.

title: Ouimet Canyon Provincial Park
description: Spectacular canyon with panoramic views, boardwalk trail. Day-use park.
duration: Half-day visit (as part of a longer trip to the region)
activityDetails: Walking boardwalk trail along canyon edge, viewing platforms, suspension bridge (nearby private attraction sometimes).

title: Georgian Bay Islands National Park
description: Archipelago of islands accessible by boat. Camping, hiking, swimming in Georgian Bay.
location: Near Honey Harbour, Ontario (access via boat from Honey Harbour)
registrationDeadline: Book campsites (Beausoleil Island) and boat taxi/DayTripper service in advance
activityDetails: Hiking, camping (Beausoleil Island), swimming, kayaking, picnicking, visitor centre in Honey Harbour.
cost: Park entry, camping fees, boat taxi/DayTripper cost.
travelTime: Approx 1.5-2 hrs to Honey Harbour, then boat

title: Lake Simcoe
description: Large lake popular for fishing (ice fishing in winter), boating, beaches. Towns like Barrie, Orillia, Keswick.
activityDetails: Fishing, boating, swimming, beaches (e.g., Innisfil Beach Park, Sibbald Point PP), ice fishing, exploring lakeside towns.
cost: Varies (free access to some areas, rentals/permits may apply)

title: Sauble Beach
description: Long sandy beach on Lake Huron, popular summer destination.
registrationDeadline: N/A (can get very busy, parking can be an issue)
activityDetails: Swimming, sunbathing, beach volleyball, classic beach town atmosphere, sunsets over Lake Huron.

title: Grand Bend
description: Popular beach town on Lake Huron with a lively main street, beach, Pinery Provincial Park nearby.
activityDetails: Swimming, sunbathing, Main Street shops and entertainment, Pinery Provincial Park (hiking, camping, beaches).
cost: Parking fees, cost of activities/food, park permit for Pinery.

title: Hamilton Waterfalls (Webster's Falls, Tew's Falls, Albion Falls, etc.)
description: Region with over 100 waterfalls due to the Niagara Escarpment. Hiking trails connect many.
startDate: Year-round (best spring/fall, some access may be restricted seasonally/due to conditions)
registrationDeadline: Check Hamilton Conservation Authority website for access/parking reservations for popular falls
activityDetails: Hiking, waterfall viewing, photography. Some falls have viewing platforms. Dundas Peak offers great views.
cost: Parking fees at conservation areas, some may require reservations.

title: Temagami
description: Wilderness region with old-growth pine forests, deep lakes, canoeing, and backcountry camping.
skillLevel: Moderate to Advanced (backcountry skills needed for some trips)
registrationDeadline: Book outfitters, guides, or permits for backcountry well in advance
activityDetails: Canoeing, kayaking, backcountry camping, hiking, fishing, visiting Temagami Fire Tower, old-growth forest trails.

title: Pukaskwa National Park
description: Canada's only wilderness national park on the Great Lakes, rugged Lake Superior coastline, hiking, kayaking.
registrationDeadline: Book campsites (Hattie Cove) or backcountry permits in advance
activityDetails: Hiking (Coastal Trail, day hikes), kayaking, canoeing, backcountry camping, visitor centre.
travelTime: Approx 10-12 hrs (Exceeds 8hr travel, but iconic Ontario wilderness)
